text:
The code contains `Base.adjoint(x::UnitaryChannel) = UnitaryChannel(adjoint.(x.operators), x.weights)`
Isn't this enough?

The adjoint is not defined like this, one should define the adjoint rule on `mat_back!` or `apply_back!`  functions. See this paper <https://arxiv.org/abs/1912.10877> and the source code here: <https://github.com/QuantumBFS/YaoBlocks.jl/blob/master/src/autodiff/mat_back.jl> . The issue of unitary channel is more likely fundamental, the source code uses the sample function, which is not analytic.
